name: Research
section_name: Learn about Poland research and records.Vault

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. FamilySearch: Get started with Poland genealogy in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Poland Genealogy

  2. Get Started: Get familiar with Polish research in the Poland GenWeb site.
  3. Use these steps for finding Polish ancestors.

    ☆ LT—4 Steps to Finding Your Polish Ancestors

  4. Here are some overviews of Polish genealogy resources.

    ☆ AA: Polish Genealogy Research Guide

  5. Use the Poland Beginning Research Wiki article for help with beginning Polish research.
  6. Get an introduction to research in Poland in these FamilySearch videos.

    ☆ FS—Research in Poland, Part 1—28:31 - 2016
    ☆ FS—Research in Poland, Part 2—23:38 - 2016

  7. Record Finder: Use the Poland Record Finder to understand record types for research.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Poland Record Finder

  8. Explore ☆Researching Your Polish Ancestors by Barb Snow.

Tips and Techniques
  1. Learn about basic techniques for Polish research.

    ☆ FS—Intro to Polish Research—53:00 - 2010

  2. Watch this video for tips on Polish research.

    ☆ AA—Getting Started in Polish Research—58:51 - 2019


  3. Learn about resources for online Polish research.

    ☆ RT—Polish Ancestry Online: Where to Search—20:25 - 2021


  4. Get answers to your ☆frequently asked questions on the Polish Genealogical Society of America site.

  2. Names and Surnames: Learn about Polish names and surnames.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Poland Names
    ☆ AF—Your Polish Surname and Its Meanings - 2019



  3. Reading Records: Watch this video for tips on reading Polish records.

    ☆ FS—Poland Research With the Wiki Part 15 of 18: Poland and Reading Languages—6:41
  4. Learn about Polish naming customs on the RootsWeb site.
  5. Search the ☆Geneanet site for Polish surnames.

  6. Search for ☆Polish surnames in a number of databases.
  7. Here are some translation tips for Polish surnames and place names.

    ☆ Tips for Getting Started with Genealogical Translations - 2020
    ☆ More Translation Tips: Resources for Surnames and Place Names - 2020

choices.name: Use effective research methods for your Polish ancestors.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research resources. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Resources: Learn about Polish record resources.

    ☆ FS—Polish Record Sources—60:28

  2. Forebears.io: Explore the ☆Forebears.io site for research records.
  3. Learn about online Polish genealogy databases.

    ☆ TH—Polish Databases Online - 2019

  4. Geneteka: Learn about the Geneteka Database in this FamilySearch article.

    ☆ FS—Geneteka Database

  5. Explore the ☆Geneteka site for research records.
In-Depth
  1. Watch these videos for additional research ideas.

    ☆ GTV—How to Research Your Polish Ancestors—47:14 - 2019


    ☆ How to seek for Polish ancestors, Part 1: Theory—9:07 - 2016



  2. Case Studies: Review these case studies in Polish research for additional techniques.

    ☆ Finding Records of Your Ancestors in Poland
    ☆ On the Trail of Stanisław Majczyk! - 2020

  3. Go into more depth with your Polish research.

    ☆ FS—Advanced Polish Research—49:00

  4. Prussia: Learn about research in Prussian Poland.

    ☆ LT—Polish Genealogy Research in the Kingdom of Prussia
    ☆ FS—Research in Prussian Poland—60:13 - 2016

  5. Follow this case study about using ship manifests to trace immigrant ancestors from Prussia.

    ☆ Finding Ancestral Homelands That Are No Longer There

  6. Galicia: Here are some tips for finding online records from Galicia, a former Austro-Hungarian province with records now spread across Poland and the Ukraine.

    ☆ Tips for finding online parish records from Galicia - 2015
    ☆ LT—Finding Vital Records for Galicia, Austria-Hungary

  7. Learn more about ancestor resources in Galicia.

    ☆ RT—Galician Ancestor Resources—20:01 - 2021


  8. Correspondence: Use this guide for corresponding with Polish organizations about genealogy resources.

    ☆ FS—Poland Letter-Writing Guide

content.text:
1. FamilySearch: Learn about Poland archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Poland Archives and Libraries
    ☆ FS—Digitized Records, Polish State Archives—4 pgs.

  2. Polish National Library: Learn about resources at the the Polish National Library in Krakow.

    ☆ LT—Inside the Polish National Archives in Kraków

  3. Sites: Explore other sites for ☆ Polish Archives and Libraries.
  4. Archives Portal: Explore the ☆Archives Portal Europe site. Click the Directories link and then select Poland.
  5. Books We Own: Explore the ☆Books We Own site for books that can be checked out or researched for you by others.

Polish State Archives
  1. Get an introduction to the Polish State Archives website.

    ☆ FS—Polish State Archives: About the Website—4:39
    ☆ FS—Polish State Archives: Language—15:20

  2. Learn more about the Polish State Archives website.

    ☆ FS—Polish State Archives: Vital Records and Civil Registers—6:12
    ☆ FS—Collections and Units—8:02

  3. Use effective keywords when searching the Polish State Archives website.

    ☆ FS—Polish State Archives: Key Words—10:30

  4. Here's a tutorial for using the Polish State Archives website.

    ☆ Szukajwarchiwach Version 2.0: Better Than the Original!

  3. Parish: Search for Polish parish records on the Polish Genealogical Society of America site.

  5. Jewish: Explore the Jewish Genealogy Encyclopedia for Jewish resources in Poland.
  6. Explore the JewishGen Poland database.

1. Learn about accessing Polish cemetery records online.

    How to look for the graves of your Polish ancestors online

  2. Explore Polish cemetery records on the Interment.net site.
  3. Explore cemetery surname records on the Polish Genealogical Society site.
  4. Search the Find A Grave site for cemetery records.
  5. Search the BillionGraves site for cemetery records.

    ☆ Using Gazetteers for Polish Genealogy - 2020

1. Explore the ☆David Rumsey collection of Poland maps.
  2. Explore old maps of Poland in the 1900 Collection.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Polish research.

content.text:

    ☆ FS—Discovering Polish Websites—46:25

  2. Explore links in ☆Michigan Polonia.
  3. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  4. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  5. Explore these FamilySearch links.

choices.name: Use QUIKLinks, Partners, and other resources to quickly search the most common record collections for Poland.

content.text:
1. QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goals above.They point to collections with 50,000 or more records. When you click a QUIKLink icon, scroll down on the resulting page to see the QUIKLinks.
  2. In the Partners section (near the top of the page), explore additional record collections in FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast and MyHeritage.
  3. 1. Explore the FamilySearch page for Polish online record collections.
  4. Explore these links to online databases and records for Poland.
  5. Explore the Polish Genealogical Society of America site for record resources.
  6. Explore the Jewish Records Indexing project for Poland.
  7. Learn about tracing Jewish roots in Poland.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get Help with your Poland research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the ☆Polish Genealogy group on Facebook.
  2. Visit the ☆Genealogy in Poland page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the ☆Central Europe Genealogical Research Community page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Poland.

choices.name: Join a mailing list, community, or message board for Poland research.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for Polish research.
  2. Explore the Poland research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Poland research.
  4. Explore Poland research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

1. Learn about Poland genealogy societies in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Poland Societies

  2. Explore Poland genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  3. Get help at a family history center in Poland.
